criteria: Distinguishing Between Two-Dimensional and Three-Dimensional Shapes
descriptions: Student is unable to identify any two-dimensional shapes.
Student can identify only one or two common two-dimensional shapes (e.g., square, circle) with prompting.
Student can identify several common two-dimensional shapes but makes frequent errors or requires assistance.
Student can accurately identify most common two-dimensional shapes with minimal errors.
Student can accurately identify a wide range of two-dimensional shapes, including less common ones, with occasional minor errors.
Student demonstrates complete and accurate identification of all two-dimensional shapes, including complex and irregular forms.
Student is unable to identify any three-dimensional shapes.
Student can identify only one or two common three-dimensional shapes (e.g., cube, sphere) with prompting.
Student can identify several common three-dimensional shapes but makes frequent errors or requires assistance.
Student can accurately identify most common three-dimensional shapes with minimal errors.
Student can accurately identify a wide range of three-dimensional shapes, including less common ones, with occasional minor errors.
Student demonstrates complete and accurate identification of all three-dimensional shapes, including complex and irregular forms.
Student cannot differentiate between two-dimensional and three-dimensional shapes.
Student shows some awareness of the difference between two-dimensional and three-dimensional shapes but struggles to articulate it or apply it consistently.
Student can sometimes differentiate between two-dimensional and three-dimensional shapes but makes frequent errors.
Student can generally differentiate between two-dimensional and three-dimensional shapes with occasional errors.
Student can consistently and accurately differentiate between two-dimensional and three-dimensional shapes, explaining the key differences.

Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the distinction between two-dimensional and three-dimensional shapes, including their properties and representations, and can apply this knowledge in various contexts.
